result.execSummary:
The defendant Hugo MILAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment or school or combination.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with co-defendant, Winfield Waak, without prior agent approval;

Submit DNA sample

timeConds.notes: under the Huber Law.   Transfer to Milwaukee County is authorized as long as there is not electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hugo MILAN

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.   
State files an Amended Information charging Conspiracy to Deliver Cocaine (>15-40G), contrary to Section 961.41(1)(cm)3 of the Wisconsin Statutes, a Class D felony.   
Guilty plea to the amended charge.   Convicted.   Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC with no sentencing recommendation to be made by the agent.   Report to be filed by 01-08-16.   Sentencing hearing is set for 01-19-16 at 2:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

Character letters, supporting articles.
Cover letter.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-24-2015 02:00 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-24-2015 01:30 pm
Plea date at 11-20-2015 08:30 am
State's Proposed Jury Instructions.
State's Motion in Limine.

Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Counsel.
Cover letter.

Motion to Modify Bond.
Cover letter.

Pretrial conference is set for 11-20-15 at 8:30 a.m.
Jury trial is set for 12-01-15 and 12-02-15 at 8:30 a.m. no: 2 position.
Scheduling conference is set for 06-25-15 at 2:30 p.m.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Scheduling conference is set for 06-25-15 at 2:30 p.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 06-23-15 at 11:30 a.m.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Defense counsel moves to reduce bail to between $2,000 and $10,000.  The State objects to any modification.
The Court order bail reduced to $25,000.00 cash.
Amended Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail issued.  Copy filed.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 05-20-2015 at 2:00 p.m.
Minutes.
Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover letter.

Motion to Modify Bond.
Cover letter.
RE:  Conspiracy to deliver cocaine, between 02-26-15 and 05-06-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of conspire to deliver cocaine.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 05-18-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $50,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, maintain absolute sobriety and have no contact with Winfield Waak.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
